etymologies: mid 16th century: from French, via Old French loien from Latin ligamen ‘bond’, from ligare ‘to bind’

definitions: a right to keep possession of property belonging to another person until a debt owed by that person is discharged

examples.text: they shall be entitled to a lien on any lot sold
make sure there are no liens against the car
they may assert a lien claim on your property

shortDefinitions: right to keep possession of property belonging to another person until debt owed by that person is discharged
